summary.para: Clients call ICoCreateLocally.CoCreateLocally to create a helper object in the same context as the server object. This allows clients to increase performance because they are running in the server application.Note Active Accessibility Text Services is deprecated. Please see Microsoft Windows Text Services Framework for more information on advanced text input and natural language technologies.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Class identifier of the object to be created locally.

param.name: dwClsContext
param.para: Context in which the helper object should run. This is usually CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER.

param.name: punk
param.para: Interface pointer to the desired interface identifier (from riid).

param.name: riidParam
param.para: An optional interface parameter that is passed to the new helper object. This parameter specifies an interface identifier.

param.name: punkParam
param.para: An optional interface parameter that is passed to the new helper object. This parameter specifies the interface pointer.

param.name: varParam
param.para: An optional interface parameter that is passed to the new helper object.

returns.para: If not successful, returns the following value or another standard COM error code.

description.para: The client does not have sufficient permissions to create this object in the server process.
